content: @nikomatsakis have alternatives to Google forms been investigated in the past? Other survey hosts provide features we might find useful. For instance, Survey Monkey lets your build your survey and translate it, but the results are all aggregated together. This won't help with free from responses but does eliminate a lot of headache munging the data.
We should ask the data munging guy, I guess, since they will be doing that work
@Jasun Carr if you have any results on your investigation of which survey host we should use, feel free to put that here.

I'm still looking into what options might work in China (it's looking that most won't without a VPN to get around the firewall), but have the basic data below. Right now, based on platform features and usability, I would recommend either SurveyMonkey or SurveyHero. Qualtrics is the most robust of the options, but for a single use like this survey it would be much too cost prohibitive.
I've created free accounts to better appraise the interfaces and options within SurveyHero & SurveyMonkey, and will update regarding those ASAP.

image.png

RUST Survey Platform Assessments:
• SurveyHero (surveyhero.com)
o One survey, multiple languages
o Single output format – reduced data wrangling
o Automatic translate powered by Google
o Ability to review translations and make edits
o Manual editing capabilities (Original text visible during translation)
o Native management of RTL text
o Requires Business ($55/mo. Individual; $39/user/mo. Team [2 minimum])/Enterprise ($89/mo. Individual; $69/user/mo. Team) level subscription
 Both for the translations and for the logic required for the Rust survey
• SurveyMonkey (surveymonkey.com)
o One survey, multiple languages
o Single output format – reduced data wrangling
o All translation done outside of survey platform
 Create survey in base language (if need RTL language, it must be the default for the survey)
 Uses set of csv files that are exported (after initial survey creation) and then imported with translation – And is a beta feature.
o No automatic translate
o Requires Team Premier ($75/user/mo. w/ 3 user minimum & billed annually)
 Both for translations & logic.
 15,000 response max
• Qualtrics
o One survey, multiple languages
o Single output format – reduced data wrangling
o Automatic translate powered by Google
o Ability to review translations and make edits
o Manual editing capabilities (Original text visible during translation)
o Can also support translation uploads
o Paid translation also available (quote basis)
o Automatic language detection based on browser setting
 Can switch language at any point in the survey (additional interface option that may be distracting?)
o Allows filter based on language
o $$$$$ (Exact amount unclear – potentially starts at $1500/year?. Would require quote…)
• Google Forms
o Separate survey for each language
o Multiple survey output – requires more data wrangling
o Ease of shared editing
o Unlimited responses
o Free
• Microsoft Forms
o One survey, multiple languages
o Single output format – reduced data wrangling
o Limited to 11 languages (or 23? Conflicting information on Microsoft resources)
o Manual editing capabilities (Original text visible during translation)
o Translation done outside of survey platform
 Create survey in base language (if need RTL language, it must be the default for the survey)
 Uses set of Excel files that are exported (after initial survey creation) and then imported with translation
o Language can be user selected or set by appending language code to the URL

@Xidorn Quan would you be able to help us with the assessment of survey providers for China? Essentially, our top picks right now are surveymonkey and surveyhero, but we're under the impression that both are blocked in China. We would also love your thoughts on whether it is worth it to have a separate solution for China versus requiring those in China to use a VPN to take the survey.
Whatever we decide for China, we can document here

@rylev I tried using a testing service https://17ce.com/ to check , it seems neither of them is specifically blocked, and at least their home page can be accessed from many areas in China. surveymonkey is seemingly less reliable than surveyhero in China, though. My guess is that surveymonkey gets resolved to different data centers like AWS HK and JP, where many IPs may have been blocked for being used as VPN in the past, so although it's not blocked, it may be affected if its IPs accidentally hit those, while surveyhero gets resolved to Ireland consistently, IPs of which are very unlikely to be blocked for this reason (because it's too far from China).
Ok that might tip us in favor of using surveyhero
Added a PR with this info to the repo: https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/pull/17
@Jasun Carr are there any updates on the platform search? I'd like to try to make a decision soon.

Yes: I've attached the full write-up below. I recommend the use of SurveyHero (as it allows for all the features we need, and should work best for users globally). It does mean paying for a subscription: I recommended a Team Business-level subscription as that provides us with all the features we need and will allow you and I to both have access to the survey platform and results. (The pricing is per-user, so if there are additional folks who you would like looped in on the survey platform they should be added to the recommendation). RUST-Survey-Platform-Assessments.docx

Let me know if there's anything missing from the recommendation or if there are any questions about the platform.
